text: Urocoma limbalis, the bordered browntail moth, is a moth of the subfamily Lymantriinae first described by Gottlieb August Wilhelm Herrich-Schäffer in 1855."Species Euproctis limbalis (Herrich-Schäffer, 1855)". Australian Faunal Directory. Archived 15 October 2012. It is known from Australia, including Queensland and New South Wales. The wingspan is about 40 mm. Adults have a dark brown body and brown wings. The wings have a band of white along the edges. Hairs on the caterpillar and cocoon may can cause mild to severe skin irritations."Discovery Centre Resources". Melbourne Museum. Archived 1 August 2008. ==References== Category:Lymantriinae
title: Urocoma limbalis
